title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to consider matching parentheses
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with `button.DISPOSED` which isn't what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again. Code assist should recognize that I have typed a '(', and that this matches 'dispose()' better than 'DISPOSED'. Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when automatically inserting suggestions.
OB: Build 204: While writing SWT code, I type 'button.dispose'. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED, intWidgetdispose(), voidWidget. I then type '(', and automatic code assist seems to insert whatever item is selected.
EB: When I type 'button.dispose(', the automatic code assist should suggest 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'.
SR:
1. Launch the application Build 204.
2. Open the code editor and start typing 'button.dispose'.
3. Observe that the code assist list appears with options: DISPOSED, intWidgetdispose(), voidWidget.
4. Continue typing '(' immediately after 'dispose'.
5. Check if the automatic code assist suggests 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'.
